clinicalDescription: Overview: Rare autoimmune conditions that causes blistering and rashes on the skin and mucous membranes. The body mistakenly sends antibodies to bind to cells in the skin. These antibodies trigger a chain reaction that separates the bottom layer of cells from above layers. Bullous pemphigoid. Cicatricial pemphigoid. Pemphigoid gestationis.Presentation: skin rashes and blistering, itchy patches, irritated blistersAssessment: Blisters are present, skin biopsy, blood tests (antibodies), thyroid testing (rule-out other diseases)Plan: Steroids, skin emollients, anti-inflammotory drugs, antibiotics for infection, immunosuppressantsPrognosis: Weeks to years of treatment before the symptoms resolve entirely. Recurrences are also extremely common.
